definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A great way to break up the classic black party dress is to add shine.
sentences.chinese: 打破老派黑色派對裝魔咒的一大法寶就是增加閃光點。

sentences.english: And all the sparkles plus the pink is a bit yuck.
sentences.chinese: 那些閃光點加上裙子的粉色看得我直觳觫。

sentences.english: Just be yourself you have the shinning point that makes you outstand.
sentences.chinese: 做自己，你有閃光點，那纔是讓你出衆的地方。
這就是德萊文的閃光點。

sentences.english: Sometimes, some humor also shines through in the search results.
sentences.chinese: 有時，你會在結果中看到一些幽默詼諧的閃光點。

sentences.english: Personally, this is where Metroplex really shines.
sentences.chinese: 個人認爲，這纔是大都市的閃光點。

sentences.english: But in broad-brush personality terms, the real you is probably shining through.
sentences.chinese: 但是真正的你其實渾身上下充滿了閃光點。

sentences.english: Another bright spot in many troubled cities is temporary jobs.
sentences.chinese: 在那些困難城市的另一個閃光點就是臨時工作。
